example.eg: The accident happened so fast that, afterwards, Jane had trouble remembering the exact sequence of events.
example.egtrans: 事故发生得实在太快，事后简很难回忆起事件发生的确切顺序。

example.eg: The dance instructor showed his class a sequence of steps.
example.egtrans: 舞蹈指导给他班上的学生教了一系列舞步。

example.eg: There is a very exciting sequence in the middle of the film.
example.egtrans: 电影进行到一半的时候，有一组非常刺激的镜头。

example.eg: Holly's piano teacher asked her to play the sequence again.
example.egtrans: 霍莉的钢琴老师让她把这段模进再弹一遍。

example.eg: Scientists study genetic sequences to understand more about hereditary diseases.
example.egtrans: 科学家研究基因序列，希望能更好地理解遗传疾病。

example.eg: Please sequence these journals in date order.
Researchers spent 13 years sequencing the human genome.
example.egtrans: 研究人员花了13年时间对人类基因组进行测序。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 测定…的序列，对…进行测序。

example.eg: Arrange the cards in sequence on the table.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 顺次地, 依次地, 按顺序地

example.eg: All my old diaries and notebooks are in sequence on my shelves.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 顺次的, 依次的, 按顺序的

example.eg: I don't understand this report; there's no logical sequence to the data.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 事情发生的顺序，事件发生的次序

example.eg: You must carefully follow a precise sequence of steps to complete the transaction.
